required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Crystalloid Versus Colloid Rapid Co-load for Cesarean Delivery Under Spinal Anesthesia
clinical_study.official_title: Crystalloid Versus Colloid Rapid Co-load in Parturients Receiving Prophylactic Phenylephrine Infusion During Cesarean Delivery Under Spinal Anesthesia

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to compare crystalloid co-loading and colloid co-loading in parturients receiving prophylactic phenylephrine infusion during cesarean delivery in terms of the incidence of hypotension.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: during the time period from induction of spinal anesthesia until delivery
primary_outcome.description: defined as: Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) < 80% of baseline SBP

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time period from induction of spinal anesthesia until delivery
secondary_outcome.description: defined as: Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) < 70% of baseline SBP

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time period from induction of spinal anesthesia until delivery
secondary_outcome.description: defined as: hypotension plus nausea and/or vomiting and/or dizziness and/or breathlessness

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time period from induction of spinal anesthesia until delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Heart Rate (HR) <50 bpm

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time period from induction of spinal anesthesia until delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP)> 120% of baseline SBP

secondary_outcome.measure: Minimum recorded Systolic Blood Pressure (Minimum SBP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time period from induction of spinal anesthesia until delivery
secondary_outcome.description: The lowest recorded SBP during the time period from induction of spinal anesthesia until delivery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time period from induction of spinal anesthesia until delivery
secondary_outcome.description: The lowest recorded HR during the time period from induction of spinal anesthesia until delivery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time period from induction of spinal anesthesia until delivery
secondary_outcome.description: duration of hypotension, minutes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time period from induction of spinal anesthesia until delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the induction of spinal anesthesia until the first event of hypotension occur

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time period from induction of spinal anesthesia until delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative dose of phenylephrine administered via continuous infusion, mcg

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time period from induction of spinal anesthesia until delivery
secondary_outcome.description: number of patients who require the rescue use of phenylephrine

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time period from induction of spinal anesthesia until delivery
secondary_outcome.description: number of patients who require the rescue use of ephedrine

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time period from induction of spinal anesthesia until delivery
secondary_outcome.description: number of patients who require the rescue use of atropine

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time period from induction of spinal anesthesia until delivery
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of nausea, vomiting

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time period from induction of spinal anesthesia until delivery
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of dizziness, breathlessness

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time period from induction of spinal anesthesia until delivery
secondary_outcome.description: noninvasive recording of skin sympathetic nerve activity (SKNA) using conventional ECG electrodes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 min, 5 min after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Apgar Score of delivered baby. The Apgar score is determined by evaluating the newborn baby on five simple criteria on a scale from zero to two, then summing up the five values thus obtained. The resulting Apgar score ranges from zero to 10. The five criteria are the Appearance, Pulse, Grimace, Activity, and Respiration. Each is scored on a scale of 0 to 2, with 2 being the best score. The test is done at 1 and 5 minutes after birth.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: pH of Umbilical Arterial blood gas analysis (ABGA) (fetal outcome)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: base excess of Umbilical ABGA (fetal outcome), mmol/L

secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: partial oxygen pressure of Umbilical ABGA (fetal outcome), mmHg

secondary_outcome.measure: Umbilical arterial carbon dioxide partial pressure (PCO2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: carbon dioxide partial pressure of Umbilical ABGA (fetal outcome), mmHg

arm_group.description: Patients will receive rapid co-load of plasma solution A (PSA) 10ml/kg, from the initiation of spinal anesthesia.
Patients will receive rapid co-load of 6% volulyte (HES in acetated electrolyte) 10ml/kg, from the initiation of spinal anesthesia.

intervention.description: Patients will receive the rapid co-loading with plasma solution A (PSA) 10ml/kg, from the initiation of spinal anesthesia, within 10 minutes.
Patients will receive the rapid co-loading with 6% volulyte (HES in acetated electrolyte) 10ml/kg, from the initiation of spinal anesthesia, within 10 minutes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy, full-term parturients who scheduled to undergo elective cesarean delivery under spinal anesthesia.
Exclusion Criteria:
- multiple pregnancy
- gestational age < 36 weeks
- preexisting or pregnancy-induced hypertension
- Morbid cardiovascular impairments
- Cerebrovascular disease
⑥ Known fetal anomaly
⑦ Contraindications to spinal anesthesia
⑧ Any sign of onset of labor
⑨ Body weight < 45 kg or body weight > 90 kg
⑩ Height < 145cm or height > 180cm

overall_official.affiliation: Seoul National University Hospital, Seoul National University College of Medicine

reference.citation: Kinsella SM, Carvalho B, Dyer RA, Fernando R, McDonnell N, Mercier FJ, Palanisamy A, Sia ATH, Van de Velde M, Vercueil A; Consensus Statement Collaborators. International consensus statement on the management of hypotension with vasopressors during caesarean section under spinal anaesthesia. Anaesthesia. 2018 Jan;73(1):71-92. doi: 10.1111/anae.14080. Epub 2017 Nov 1.

Ripollés Melchor J, Espinosa Á, Martínez Hurtado E, Casans Francés R, Navarro Pérez R, Abad Gurumeta A, Calvo Vecino JM. Colloids versus crystalloids in the prevention of hypotension induced by spinal anesthesia in elective cesarean section. A systematic review and meta-analysis. Minerva Anestesiol. 2015 Sep;81(9):1019-30. Epub 2014 Dec 11. Review.

Tawfik MM, Tarbay AI, Elaidy AM, Awad KA, Ezz HM, Tolba MA. Combined Colloid Preload and Crystalloid Coload Versus Crystalloid Coload During Spinal Anesthesia for Cesarean Delivery: A Randomized Controlled Trial. Anesth Analg. 2019 Feb;128(2):304-312. doi: 10.1213/ANE.0000000000003306.

Doytchinova A, Hassel JL, Yuan Y, Lin H, Yin D, Adams D, Straka S, Wright K, Smith K, Wagner D, Shen C, Salanova V, Meshberger C, Chen LS, Kincaid JC, Coffey AC, Wu G, Li Y, Kovacs RJ, Everett TH 4th, Victor R, Cha YM, Lin SF, Chen PS. Simultaneous noninvasive recording of skin sympathetic nerve activity and electrocardiogram. Heart Rhythm. 2017 Jan;14(1):25-33. doi: 10.1016/j.hrthm.2016.09.019. Epub 2016 Sep 23.
